import os
import django
os.environ.setdefault(''DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'', ''maxBreak.settings'')
django.setup()
from oneFourSeven.models import Event
from datetime import date

print(''=== TOURNAMENT DATABASE ANALYSIS ==='')

seasons = {}
for event in events:
    season = event.Season or ''Unknown''
    if season not in seasons:
        seasons[season] = []
    seasons[season].append(event)

for season, events_list in seasons.items():
    print(f''\nSeason {season}: {len(events_list)} tournaments'')
    for event in events_list[:5]:  # First 5
        start_date = event.StartDate.strftime(''%Y-%m-%d'') if event.StartDate else ''No date''
        print(f''  - {event.Name} ({start_date})'')
    if len(events_list) > 5:
        print(f''  ... and {len(events_list) - 5} more'')

import os
import django
os.environ.setdefault(''DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'', ''maxBreak.settings'')
django.setup()
from oneFourSeven.models import Event, MatchesOfAnEvent
from datetime import date, timedelta

print(''=== RECENT TOURNAMENTS AND MATCH STATUS ==='')
today = date.today()

# Get recent events
recent_events = Event.objects.filter(
    EndDate__gte=today - timedelta(days=7),  # Events that ended in last 7 days
    EndDate__lte=today + timedelta(days=1)   # Up to tomorrow
).order_by(''-EndDate'')[:5]

for event in recent_events:
    print(f''\nEvent: {event.Name}'')
    print(f''  ID: {event.ID}'')
    print(f''  Dates: {event.StartDate} to {event.EndDate}'')
    
    # Check match statuses
    matches = MatchesOfAnEvent.objects.filter(Event=event)
    status_counts = {}
    for match in matches:
        status = match.Status or -1
        status_counts[status] = status_counts.get(status, 0) + 1
    
    if status_counts:
        print(f''  Match statuses: {status_counts}'')
        print(f''    0=Scheduled: {status_counts.get(0, 0)}'')
        print(f''    1=Running: {status_counts.get(1, 0)}'')  
        print(f''    2=On Break: {status_counts.get(2, 0)}'')
        print(f''    3=Finished: {status_counts.get(3, 0)}'')
        
        # Check if tournament should be finished
        if event.EndDate and event.EndDate < today:
            print(f''  ‚ö†Ô∏è Tournament ended {(today - event.EndDate).days} days ago'')
            if status_counts.get(1, 0) > 0 or status_counts.get(2, 0) > 0:
                print(f''  üî• ISSUE: Still has {status_counts.get(1, 0)} running + {status_counts.get(2, 0)} on-break matches!'')
    else:
        print(f''  No matches found'')
")

import os
import django
os.environ.setdefault(''DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE'', ''maxBreak.settings'')

from oneFourSeven.scraper import fetch_h2h_data

print(''Testing H2H with corrected API (all seasons)...'')

test_pairs = [
    (5, 12),    # Ronnie O''Sullivan vs Judd Trump  
    (154, 30),  # Neil Robertson vs Stuart Bingham
    (202, 154), # Mark Allen vs Neil Robertson
]

for i, (p1, p2) in enumerate(test_pairs):
    print(f''\n=== Test {i+1}: Players {p1} vs {p2} ==='')
    h2h_data = fetch_h2h_data(p1, p2)
    print(f''Response type: {type(h2h_data)}'')
    
    if h2h_data and isinstance(h2h_data, list) and len(h2h_data) > 0:
        print(f''SUCCESS: Got {len(h2h_data)} H2H matches!'')
        
        # Count wins for each player
        p1_wins = sum(1 for match in h2h_data if match.get(''WinnerID'') == p1)
        p2_wins = sum(1 for match in h2h_data if match.get(''WinnerID'') == p2)

        print(f''Player {p2} wins: {p2_wins}'')

from django.test import Client

print(''=== SAUDI ARABIA MASTERS DATA ACCURACY VERIFICATION ==='')

# Find Saudi Arabia Masters 2025
saudi = Event.objects.filter(Name__icontains=''Saudi'', Season=2025).first()
if not saudi:
    print(''ERROR: Saudi Arabia Masters 2025 not found'')
    exit()

print(f''Event: {saudi.Name} (ID: {saudi.ID})'')
print(f''Dates: {saudi.StartDate} to {saudi.EndDate}'')
print(f''Venue: {saudi.Venue}, {saudi.City}, {saudi.Country}'')

# Check round details accuracy
print(''\n=== ROUND FORMAT VERIFICATION ==='')
rounds = RoundDetails.objects.filter(Event=saudi).order_by(''Round'')

correct_data = True
issues = []

for rd in rounds:
    print(f''Round {rd.Round}: ""{rd.RoundName}"" -> ""{rd.get_correct_round_name()}""'')
    print(f''  NumLeft: {rd.NumLeft} | Distance: {rd.Distance} | Format: {rd.get_format_text()}'')
    
    # Verify specific known data points
    if rd.Round == 7 and rd.NumLeft == 144:  # First round
        if rd.Distance != 4:
            issues.append(f''Round 7 (First Round) should be Best of 7 (Distance=4), got Distance={rd.Distance}'')
        if rd.get_correct_round_name() != ''Last 144'':
            issues.append(f''Round 7 should be ""Last 144"", got ""{rd.get_correct_round_name()}""'')
    
    if rd.Round == 15 and rd.NumLeft == 2:  # Final
        if rd.Distance != 10:
            issues.append(f''Final should be Best of 19 (Distance=10), got Distance={rd.Distance}'')
        if rd.get_correct_round_name() != ''Final'':
            issues.append(f''Final should be ""Final"", got ""{rd.get_correct_round_name()}""'')
    print()

# Test API accuracy
print(''=== API ENDPOINT ACCURACY ==='')
client = Client()

# Test Round 7 (First Round - Last 144)
response = client.get(''/oneFourSeven/match-format/7/2025/'')
if response.status_code == 200:
    data = json.loads(response.content.decode(''utf-8''))
    if data and len(data) > 0:
        format_data = data[0]
        print(''Round 7 API Test:'')
        print(f''  Distance: {format_data.get(""Distance"")} (should be 4 for Best of 7)'')
        print(f''  DistanceText: {format_data.get(""DistanceText"")} (should be ""Best of 7"")'')
        print(f''  RoundName: {format_data.get(""RoundName"")} (should show correct name)'')
        
        if format_data.get(''Distance'') != 4:
            issues.append(''API Round 7: Wrong distance (should be 4 for Best of 7)'')

# Check match data integrity
print(''\n=== MATCH DATA VERIFICATION ==='')
match_count = MatchesOfAnEvent.objects.filter(Event=saudi).count()
print(f''Total matches: {match_count}'')

# Check status distribution
status_counts = {}
for status_code, status_name in MatchesOfAnEvent.STATUS_CHOICES:
    count = MatchesOfAnEvent.objects.filter(Event=saudi, Status=status_code).count()
    if count > 0:
        status_counts[status_name] = count

print(''Match status distribution:'')
for status, count in status_counts.items():
    print(f''  {status}: {count} matches'')

# Final assessment
print(''\n=== ACCURACY ASSESSMENT ==='')
if issues:
    print(''ISSUES FOUND:'')
    for issue in issues:
        print(f''  - {issue}'')
    correct_data = False
else:
    print(''SUCCESS: No data accuracy issues found!'')
    print(''Saudi Arabia Masters data appears correct:'')
    print(''  - Round naming: Fixed (Last 144, Last 32, etc.)'')
    print(''  - Match formats: Accurate (Best of 7, 9, 11, 19)'')
    print(''  - Tournament structure: Complete'')

print(f''\nData accuracy status: {""VERIFIED"" if correct_data else ""NEEDS ATTENTION""}'')
")

from datetime import date, timedelta

past = Event.objects.filter(Season=2025, EndDate__lt=today).count()

from oneFourSeven.models import Event, MatchesOfAnEvent
from datetime import date, timedelta

print(''=== DATABASE STATUS CHECK ==='')
today = date.today()
print(f''Today: {today}'')

# Check current active tournaments
active_events = Event.objects.filter(
    StartDate__lte=today,
    EndDate__gte=today
).order_by(''-StartDate'')

print(f''\nACTIVE TOURNAMENTS ({active_events.count()}):'')
for event in active_events:
    match_count = MatchesOfAnEvent.objects.filter(Event=event).count()
    print(f''  {event.Name} (ID: {event.ID})'')
    print(f''    Dates: {event.StartDate} to {event.EndDate}'')
    print(f''    Matches: {match_count}'')
    print(f''    Tour: {event.Tour}'')
    print()

# Check upcoming tournaments (next 30 days)
upcoming = Event.objects.filter(
    StartDate__gt=today,
    StartDate__lte=today + timedelta(days=30)
).order_by(''StartDate'')[:5]

print(f''UPCOMING TOURNAMENTS (next 30 days, showing first 5):'')
for event in upcoming:
    match_count = MatchesOfAnEvent.objects.filter(Event=event).count()
    print(f''  {event.Name} (ID: {event.ID})'')
    print(f''    Starts: {event.StartDate}'')  
    print(f''    Matches: {match_count}'')
    print(f''    Tour: {event.Tour}'')
    print()

# Check recent tournaments with matches
recent_with_matches = Event.objects.filter(
    EndDate__gte=today - timedelta(days=7),
    matches__isnull=False
).distinct().order_by(''-EndDate'')[:3]

print(f''RECENT TOURNAMENTS WITH MATCHES:'')
for event in recent_with_matches:
    match_count = MatchesOfAnEvent.objects.filter(Event=event).count()
    live_matches = MatchesOfAnEvent.objects.filter(Event=event, Status__in=[1, 2]).count()
    print(f''  {event.Name} (ID: {event.ID})'')
    print(f''    Dates: {event.StartDate} to {event.EndDate}'')
    print(f''    Matches: {match_count} (Live: {live_matches})'')
    print(f''    Tour: {event.Tour}'')
    print()
")

for status, count in status_counts.items():
    status_name = {0: ''Scheduled'', 1: ''Live'', 2: ''On Break'', 3: ''Finished'', -1: ''Unknown''}
    print(f''  {status_name.get(status, f""Status {status}"")}: {count}'')

print()

        print(f''    Scheduled: {match.ScheduledDate}'')

from oneFourSeven.models import UpcomingMatch

from datetime import timedelta

print(''=== CHECKING UPCOMING MATCHES IN DATABASE ==='')
total = UpcomingMatch.objects.count()
print(f''Total upcoming matches: {total}'')

if total > 0:
    # Check date ranges
    earliest = UpcomingMatch.objects.order_by(''scheduled_date'').first()
    latest = UpcomingMatch.objects.order_by(''-scheduled_date'').first()

    # Check today and next few days

    for i in range(8):
        date_check = now + timedelta(days=i)
        count = UpcomingMatch.objects.filter(scheduled_date__date=date_check.date()).count()
        print(f''{date_check.strftime(""%Y-%m-%d %A"")}: {count} matches'')
